Uses of Package
Funds.DataObjects

  • Packages that use Funds.DataObjects 
    Package Description
    Funds
    The .java and .fxml files relating to the primary Graphical User Interface for this application.
    Funds.DataObjects
    The actual Java bean style data organizing classes for this project
    Funds.Dialogs
    In an attempt to minimize clutter that typically comes along with GUI's on accounting software most user interaction is handled via dialog boxes and this package holds all of the .java controllers and .fxml GUI's in an attempt to keep this mess of files somewhat organized.
    Funds.Tools.BookExport
    At times it is necessary to send data from a program elsewhere for processing, this object allows data to exported in the four most common formats for transferring and handling data: XML, JSON, CSV, SQL.
    Funds.Tools.Budgeting.RevenueSplitter
    Revenue often comes in as one lump sum but needs distributed to a number of accounts this tool performs the calculations when these distributions are percentage based
    Funds.Tools.GeneralLedger
    By the nature of accounting software it may remain in use for quite some time, which means that the list of transactions being tracked can grow quite extensive, this tool provides filter and view options for sorting through the list of transactions recorded in the book.
  • Classes in Funds.DataObjects used by Funds 
    Class Description
    Account
    The Account class will be the primary working tool for organizing the transactions in terms of money coming in or money going out using the standard accounting practice of double-entry method.
    Book
    A Book is the main organizer object for this whole software application, transactions will be collected into Accounts, and the Book is a collection of accounts with measures taken to assure it is balanced, and the Book object is what will be saved/opened/worked-with by users for ongoing concerns in accounting.
    Book.AccountController
    All of the dialogs keep a reference to the current Book object, but not the primary GUI controller, so this interface assures there is a way to call the methods on the primary GUI from any dialog
  • Classes in Funds.DataObjects used by Funds.DataObjects 
    Class Description
    Account
    The Account class will be the primary working tool for organizing the transactions in terms of money coming in or money going out using the standard accounting practice of double-entry method.
    AccountCategory
    A identifiable list of accounts of the same primary type so that the Book object has a way to grab only the accounts in a certain category as organized on the balance sheet appearance of the main GUI
    Book
    A Book is the main organizer object for this whole software application, transactions will be collected into Accounts, and the Book is a collection of accounts with measures taken to assure it is balanced, and the Book object is what will be saved/opened/worked-with by users for ongoing concerns in accounting.
    Book.AccountController
    All of the dialogs keep a reference to the current Book object, but not the primary GUI controller, so this interface assures there is a way to call the methods on the primary GUI from any dialog
    Transaction
    An Transaction is the basic building block of the whole thing, it is a collection of datafields representing a single real-world monetary transaction.
